Dialogue:
DL: Good evening, how can I assist you today?
DK: Thank you. What can I do for you?
DL: Do you have any favorite foods?
DK: I enjoy katsudon and had it today.
DL: I had katsudon this morning as well.
DK: Do you often eat in the morning?
DL: Yes, I eat more in the morning and less at night.
DK: Has this been a long-term habit?
DL: Yes, since I was on a diet.
DK: Eating before bed can lead to weight gain.
DL: Late-night snacks can be tempting.
DK: Instant yakisoba and alcohol used to be my late-night choices.
DL: That combination is popular.
DK: Recently, I've avoided drinking at night.
DL: Are you having alcohol-free days?
DK: I don't drink every day. Non-alcoholic drinks have become more common.
DL: How do non-alcoholic drinks taste?
DK: Domestic non-alcoholic beers have a strong aroma. Low-alcohol Beery is good.
DL: Is the taste close to the real thing?
DK: I prefer non-alcoholic beer from Germany, sold at Gyomu Super.
DL: I visit Gyomu Super often. They have various kinds of alcohol.
DK: I mainly buy alcohol and sweets.
DL: Any recommendations?
DK: Spicy Mala Ikari Beans.
DL: I'll look for them next time. I buy squid fries.
DK: Fried squid is nice.
DL: It pairs well with beer.
DK: Agreed.
DL: I want to drink too. Those beans sound interesting.
DK: Given the time, patience is best.

DL: Please take care of it.
DE: Certainly.
DL: Do you have any favorite foods?
DE: Takoyaki from the supermarket deli.
DL: Is it because of the large octopus pieces?
DE: The dashi flavor and chewy texture.
DL: That sounds appealing.
DE: It's unique.
DL: Do different shops have varied flavors?
DE: Yes. What food do you prefer?
DL: Fried foods, especially tonkatsu.
DE: I often have katsu sandwiches.
DL: The crispy texture is nice.
DE: Are you familiar with Märchen sandwich shop?
DL: No. What types of sandwiches do they offer?
DE: Cutlet and fruit-based cream sandwiches.
DL: Do you have any favorites?
DE: Strawberries, mandarins, pineapples, and Shine Muscat grapes.
DL: Shine Muscat sounds good.
DE: They also have seasonal options.
DL: Are there multiple locations?
DE: At large JR stations, like Shinagawa.
DL: I'll try one next time.
DE: Worth trying.
DL: Rewarding yourself with delicious food is important.
DE: Yes, rewarding yourself is important.
DL: Little joys are needed now.
DE: Delicious food helps maintain happiness.
DL: I agree.
DE: Food is important.

DL: Good evening. How can I assist you today?
DU: Good evening. How can I assist you today?
DL: Have you had any pleasant experiences recently?
DU: Are you referring to something specific? I have plans to attend a weekend camp festival.
DL: Is it a camping festival? Does that mean various people camp at the same place?
DU: Yes, and it's combined with a music festival.
DL: Music as well? Are various artists participating?
DU: Various famous artists, including reggae performers, will be there. It will be my first festival.
DL: During the day you can camp, and at night enjoy music, correct? That sounds enjoyable.
DU: You can enjoy music and shopping all day and then sleep in a tent at night.
DL: Do you often go camping?
DU: I started at the end of last year, so my camping experience is limited.
DL: Did something trigger your interest at the end of the year?
DU: My husband was interested, but I wasn't at first. Seeing friends enjoy it sparked my interest.
DL: Did you enjoy it more than you expected when you tried it?
DU: Yes, I became very interested and started wanting more gear.
DL: What kind of gear are you interested in now?
DU: I want another tent, but I already have three and storage is an issue.
DL: You have three tents already and still want more? Is it due to their features or brands?
DU: It might be due to differences in appearance or size.
DL: Do you want to use them for different purposes?
DU: Yes. Initially, I saw it as a disaster drill, but now I want to differentiate between them.
DL: It seems like you are really into it.
DU: It's a bit troubling.
DL: Do tents cost a lot?
DU: The price varies. I started with a pop-up tent under 20,000 yen.
DL: So 20,000 yen is considered cheap? Are there more expensive options?
DU: Yes, some can exceed 100,000 yen.
DL: Once you get particular about it, it seems hard to stop!
DU: One-touch tents are spacious and can accommodate 4-5 people sleeping.

DL: Good evening. How can I assist you today?
DY: Good evening. How can I assist you today?
DL: Are you into any new hobbies recently?
DY: I've been playing games.
DL: Console or smartphone?
DY: Switch.
DL: Which game?
DY: Splatoon.
DL: Frequent player?
DY: Yes, looking forward to next week’s new release.
DL: Is Splatoon 3 coming out? Pre-ordered?
DY: Yes, and yes.
DL: Online matches hard for beginners?
DY: Matched by rank.
DL: Good to know. Hesitant to try.
DY: Controls tricky at first but you adapt.
DL: Might try then.
DY: Start with Splatoon 3.
DL: Trial version available?
DY: Last Sunday.
DL: Missed it.
DY: Free for 12 hours.
DL: Did you play?
DY: Yes, for 2 hours. It was fun.
DL: Promising?
DY: Very enjoyable. Excited.
DL: Your excitement is evident. Looking forward now.
DY: It's a good game. Try it.
DL: Will consider after demo release.
DY: Please do when available.

DL: Good evening.  
CB: Good evening. How can I assist you today?  
DL: Have you been interested in anything lately?  
CB: I've been watching dramas and YouTube videos.  
DL: I also watch YouTube. What kind of genres do you watch?  
CB: I often watch videos by Yusuke Narita and Hiroyuki.  
DL: I’m not familiar with them. What kind of content do they cover?  
CB: They discuss topics like economics and various other subjects.  
DL: By "various topics," do you mean beyond just economics?  
CB: Yes, they cover a wide range of subjects.  
DL: I struggle with face-to-face conversations. How about you?  
CB: I am comfortable with one-on-one conversations but find large groups challenging.  
DL: Same here. I get nervous and flustered in large groups.  
CB: How do you communicate at work?  
DL: I work with the same people regularly, so our communication is friendly. Initially, it was challenging.  
CB: Stressful relationships can be challenging.  
DL: How is your work environment?  
CB: I am managing three different jobs, which helps change the pace.  
DL: Three jobs? Isn’t that confusing?  
CB: I am managing well for now.  
DL: What kind of work do you do?  
CB: I work as a caregiver, in a home office, and at a call center.  
DL: That's quite diverse. Did you choose these fields out of interest?  
CB: My home office work decreased, so I took on part-time jobs.  
DL: Is that because of COVID-19?  
CB: The decrease in work is related but not directly due to COVID-19.  
DL: Our workplace was slightly affected by COVID-19.  
CB: How was your job affected?  
DL: We are in manufacturing, and material supplies were delayed because of COVID-19.  
CB: I understand. Import businesses are indeed impacted by COVID-19.

DL: Good evening. Can you assist me today?
CB: Good evening! How can I help you tonight?
DL: Have you had dinner already?
CB: Yes, I had curry udon. It was delicious!
DL: Curry udon sounds good. What's your favorite food?
CB: I really love curry.
DL: Do you make it yourself?
CB: Yes, I enjoy experimenting with different types of curry.
DL: Do you use spices from scratch? How does it compare to store-bought curry?
CB: Making it from scratch lets you customize the flavors. It's quite different from store-bought curry.
DL: What inspired you to start making it from spices?
CB: My love for Indian curry inspired me to recreate the flavors at home.
DL: Have you traveled abroad for it?
CB: Yes, I've been to Bangladesh and Thailand.
DL: Is the food very different from Japan's?
CB: Yes, the flavors are unique and vary by country.
DL: Have you visited any countries where the food didn't suit you?
CB: I haven't traveled extensively. What about you?
DL: No, traveling makes me nervous.
CB: I understand. Having an acquaintance abroad made it easier for me.
DL: Wow, traveling alone takes guts! Were you nervous at all?
CB: When I was younger, I was more adventurous. Now, I'd be more hesitant.
DL: What was your first trip abroad like?
CB: It had its challenges, like a delayed flight, but I met wonderful people and had a great time.
DL: Did you learn the local language before going?
CB: I relied on a phrasebook for basic communication.
DL: Were you able to communicate effectively with that?
CB: Having an interpreter really helped and made me feel more comfortable.
DL: Having an interpreter must have been comforting.
CB: Absolutely, it made the whole experience much smoother.
